radiographic_examinations.findings: Giant ICA aneurysm with extensive osseous remodeling at the skull base and erosion into the sphenoid sinus. Large vessels in the right sylvian fissure, an enhancing tuft of abnormal vessels in the right basal ganglia, and some midline shift.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative angiograms demonstrated patency of the bypass graft and occlusion of the right ICA with thrombosis of the aneurysm. A follow-up angiogram obtained 6 months after surgery revealed excellent patency of the SVG and complete thrombosis of the aneurysm.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Giant fusiform aneurysm of the right ICA, extending from the distal cavernous carotid segment to the supraclinoid segment measuring 15x25 mm. Significant dilation of the distal supraclinoid ICA and accompanying angiodysplasia.
